instruction: Can the proposed method for integrating hyperspectral and geochemical data be used to improve the efficiency and accuracy of identifying and quantifying the abundance of different chemical elements in drill-core samples in the mining industry?
Output: Yes, the proposed method for integrating hyperspectral and geochemical data can be used to improve the efficiency and accuracy of identifying and quantifying the abundance of different chemical elements in drill-core samples in the mining industry. The method combines the complementary information derived from hyperspectral and geochemical data using a superpixel-based machine learning framework. By considering the difference in spatial resolution through segmentation, the method extracts labels from the geochemical assays and selects representative samples from the hyperspectral data. A supervised machine learning classification is then used to extrapolate the elements' relative abundance to the entire core length. The results of a qualitative and quantitative evaluation demonstrate that the proposed method provides approximately 20% more accurate results than the pixel-based approach. Additionally, the method has the potential to reduce the number of geochemical assays needed for detailed analysis of the cores, further improving efficiency in the mining industry.
